page.title: 08CHARLBURY ENVIRONMENT
page.content: The area around Charlbury is mostly agricultural with barley,wheat and oilseed rape as the main crops.There is also quite a bit of woodland which provides cover for pheasants and partridges as well as foxes, rabbits and hares.The undulating roads have hedges or stone walls alongside them and the area is criss crossed by public footpaths. This area is quite hilly and Charlbury is surrounded by the Cotswold villages of Chadlington,Spelsbury,Dean, Taston,Fawler,Finstock and Leafield. At Dean there is a new waste disposal site where people dump rubbish. From Wychwood Forest,which contains Cornbury House and Park, there are extensive views over the Evenlode Valley and the West Oxfordshire Cotswolds.
